text: Sienna Street (Polish: Ulica Sienna, lit. Hay Street) - a historic street in Kraków, Poland. The street extends from the Main Square towards Westerplatte Street. The street was part of a former trading route between Wieliczka, Tarnów and Lwów. After the junction near the Planty Park, the street extends as Starowiślna Street. Its former name was Zwierzęca Street (Ulica Zwierzęca, lit. Animal Street) due to nearby slaughter houses. The street would also be known as Szkolna Street (Ulica Szkolna, lit. School Street) due to the former existence of a nearby school devoted to the Virgin Mary. ==Features== {| |----- bgcolor="#FF 8C 00" ! width=4% | Street No. ! width=26% | Short description ! width=10% | Picture |----- bgcolor="#FFF8E1" | align="center"| 5 || align="center"| Bidermanowski House - a Mannerist house built between 1912 and 1914. Presently, the retail ground floor houses a boutique of the Spanish retailer Zara. || align="center"| 100px |----- bgcolor="#FFF8E1" | align="center"| 6 || align="center"| Grey House - built in the eighteenth- century. Presently, the building houses offices and office space (e.g. British Council) on the ground floor, with private apartments located on upper floors. It is one of the largest townhouses in the Old Town. || align="center"| 100px |} ==References== Category:Streets in Kraków
title: Sienna Street, Kraków
